intro: Lithophragma williamsii, commonly known as Williams' stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial with fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a white waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Lithophragma williamsii is adapted to harsh environments and is an important species in its native ecosystem.
